snippet: The police cleared protesters from a major boulevard in Bangkok as part of an effort to reclaim areas that have been closed during a push to unseat Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra.
abstract: Thai police manage to clear antigovernment protesters from a major boulevard in Bangkok for a short time as the authorities try to reclaim areas that have been closed during a three-month push to unseat Prime Min Yingluck Shinawatra.
lead_paragraph: The police cleared protesters from a major boulevard in Bangkok as part of an effort to reclaim areas that have been closed during a push to unseat Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra.
